body_html:
Hi @sherrym , no luck so far with meta_graphs.

meta_graph is saved successfully (or, at least, no errors thrown) via:

tf.train.export_meta_graph(filename=outfiles['meta'], collection_list=[self.restore_key],
                           graph_def = sesh.graph_def, saver_def = tf.train.SaverDef())

Trying to restore via:

tf.train.import_meta_graph(outfiles['meta'])

Throws: IOError: Cannot parse file ./model.meta: 2:1 : Expected identifier..

Not sure if this is the problem, but I have not found any documentation of what the meta_info_def kwarg (of export_meta_graph) expects.

body:
Hi @sherrym , no luck so far with `meta_graphs`.

meta_graph is saved successfully (or, at least, no errors thrown) via:

```
tf.train.export_meta_graph(filename=outfiles['meta'], collection_list=[self.restore_key],
                           graph_def = sesh.graph_def, saver_def = tf.train.SaverDef())
```

Trying to restore via:

```
tf.train.import_meta_graph(outfiles['meta'])
```

Throws: `IOError: Cannot parse file ./model.meta: 2:1 : Expected identifier..`

Not sure if this is the problem, but I have not found any documentation of what the `meta_info_def` kwarg (of `export_meta_graph`) expects.
